intro: Styphelia echinulata, commonly known as the hairy stylewort, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of white, bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathland and coastal dunes. Styphelia echinulata is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds, making it a resilient species in harsh coastal environments. Its flowers bloom in spring, attracting a variety of pollinators such as bees and birds.
